Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched a gem, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees
Aaron Judge made a catch to secure the final out
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees will play Cleveland or Detroit in the ALCS starting Monday night at Yankee Stadium
The Kansas City Royals went from a 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making their first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years
Tensions that had simmered all night finally boiled over in the sixth
Others: Michael Wacha failed to get through five innings for Kansas City, allowing two runs, six hits and a walk
Stanton, who hit the go-ahead homer in the eighth inning in Game 3, extended the lead to 3-0 with his single in the sixth
